messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Barter and e Bay Introducing The Rall Family
messages.msgSnippet: ... Aw, see, I would ve paid you more, lol! Well, or barter if you definitely don t want it. Ya know, an unschooling barter list would come in handy, wouldn t
messages.messageBody:
ejcrewe@... writes:
> I did once sell all my cross stitch and needlepoint
> kits on eBay for $1 each. Mostly, I just collect this stuff, hoping to
> someday go back to it!
>
> Elizabeth


Aw, see, I would've paid you more, lol!

Well, or barter if you definitely don't want it.
Ya know, an unschooling barter list would come in handy, wouldn't it? We
wouldn't worry so much about buying stuff the kids don't end up liking if some
other kids would use it later......

Or, that's what basements are for. lol My FIL has tons of stuff down
there, he's gone thru at least 10 hobbies and saves everything. Good for us,
we've gotten fishtank stuff, woodworking stuff, National Geograpics from 20 years
ago, etc!

~Aimee


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
